channel.title: Projects on Kyle S
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Kyle S

item.title: GDP components over time and among countries
item.description: At the risk of oversimplifying things, the main components of gross domestic product, GDP are personal consumption (C), business investment (I), government spending (G) and net exports (exports - imports). You can read more about GDP and the different approaches in calculating at the Wikipedia GDP page. The GDP data we will look at is from the United Nations’ National Accounts Main Aggregates Database, which contains estimates of total GDP and its components for all countries from 1970 to today.

item.title: Omega Group plc - Pay Discrimination Analysis
item.description: At the last board meeting of Omega Group Plc., the headquarters of a large multinational company, the issue was raised that women were being discriminated in the company, in the sense that the salaries were not the same for male and female executives. A quick analysis of a sample of 50 employees (of which 24 men and 26 women) revealed that the average salary for men was about 8,700 higher than for women.

item.title: Regression Analysis for Shanghai AirBnBs
item.description: Introduction In our final group assignment, we analyse data about Airbnb listings, and we try to find a model to predict the total cost for two people staying 4 nights in an AirBnB in Shanghai. Our data set comes from insideairbnb.com; it was originally scraped from airbnb.com. Our work is structured as follows: We begin by cleaning our data set.

item.title: Yield Curve Invesion
item.description: Every so often, we hear warnings from commentators on the “inverted yield curve” and its predictive power with respect to recessions. The question is, is this a self-fulfilling prophecy or not? The wonderful and beautfiul short story below, illustrates what we mean by that: In our case we will look at US data and use the FRED database to download historical yield curve rates, and plot the yield curves since 1999 to see when the yield curves flatten.

item.title: Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance
item.description: Every two years, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention conduct the Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance System (YRBSS) survey, where it takes data from high schoolers (9th through 12th grade), to analyze health patterns. We will work with a selected group of variables from a random sample of observations during one of the years the YRBSS was conducted. Load the data This data is part of the openintro textbook and we can load and inspect it.
